ACTION BASEBALL LEAGUE
ALL TRANSACTIONS
12/31/1977
BNN Index | ABL | SCORES | STANDINGS | STATS | TEAMS | PLAYERS | TRANSACTIONS | HISTORY
 
Saturday, December 31st , 1977
New York Aces: Signed international amateur SP Jesus Inzunza out of Dominican Republic to a minor league contract.
Friday, December 30th , 1977
St. Louis Stallions: Signed free agent 1B Justin Dwight to a minor league contract.
Dallas Rustlers: Signed international amateur SP Hélder Barroco out of Venezuela to a minor league contract.
The Los Angeles Cobras traded 23-year old minor league 1B Justin Poole to the Las Vegas Gamblers, getting 32-year old RHP Aaron McDonald in return.
The Pittsburgh Express traded 31-year old 2B Alejandro Peinado and 22-year old 3B Dave Barajas to the San Francisco Warriors, getting 25-year old RF Luis Sanchez in return.
Thursday, December 29th , 1977
Chicago Fire: Signed free agent RP Bill Ramirez to a 1-year contract worth a total of $65,000.
Portland Lumberjacks: Signed free agent RF Tim Bowman to a minor league contract.
Chicago Fire: RP Pedro Saavedra was designated for assignment, placed on waivers and taken off the secondary (40-man) roster.
Minneapolis Blizzard: Claimed SP Steve Usher off waivers from Atlanta.
New York Aces: Signed international amateur SP Aldred van Velzen out of The Netherlands to a minor league contract.
St. Louis Stallions: Signed international amateur SP Jacques Pollaiuolo out of Venezuela to a minor league contract.
Wednesday, December 28th , 1977
Nashville Blues: Signed free agent 3B Chris Sullivan to a 3-year contract worth a total of $1,464,000.
Tampa Bay Storm: Signed free agent RP Hughie Segal to a minor league contract.
Dallas Rustlers: Signed free agent 1B Nate Stenglein to a minor league contract.
Chicago Fire: Signed free agent CL Eric Dibley to a minor league contract.
Detroit Dukes: Signed free agent RF Geoff Tucker to a minor league contract.
San Diego Seraphs: Claimed SP Robbie Kendall off waivers from Chicago.
Las Vegas Gamblers: Signed international amateur CF Daniel Manzo out of Dominican Republic to a minor league contract.
The Denver Rocketeers traded 27-year old 2B Miguel Pena (retaining 45%) to the Cincinnati Cougars, getting 24-year old 1B Jesus Arras in return.
Tuesday, December 27th , 1977
Tampa Bay Storm: Signed free agent RP Mike Black to a minor league contract with a major league option.
Chicago Fire: Signed free agent RP Chris Biggs to a minor league contract.
Charlotte Colonels: Signed international amateur SP Jon Acosta out of Venezuela to a minor league contract.

Wednesday, December 14th , 1977
St. Louis Stallions: Signed free agent 1B Mark Gibson to a minor league contract.
The Minneapolis Blizzard traded 22-year old minor league SS Ben Elder, 24-year old minor league RF Joe Myers Jr., and 23-year old minor league 2B Jonathan Ramos to the Miami Hurricanes, getting 33-year old RHP Anthony Solomon (retaining 100%) in return.
The Boston Patriots traded 24-year old CF Leo Diaz and 18-year old minor league RHP Jesus Hernandez to the Seatlle Comets, getting 32-year old CF Cameron Taylor (retaining 70%) and 20-year old minor league 3B Alberto Santos in return.
The Atlanta Kings traded 24-year old minor league SS Israel Lugo and 23-year old minor league 2B Cheng-hao Ma to the Detroit Dukes, getting 31-year old minor league RHP Randy Jefferson in return.
The Cincinnati Cougars traded 23-year old LF Jon Cruz, 24-year old minor league 2B Nick Smith, and 23-year old minor league LF Mario Silva to the Tampa Bay Storm, getting 29-year old RHP Mason Chaisson in return.

The San Francisco Warriors traded 23-year old minor league LHP Adam Smith, 24-year old minor league RHP Elias Rivas, and 21-year old minor league 2B Jesus Gutierrez to the Boston Patriots, getting 32-year old SS Joe Rogers (retaining 65%) in return.

Dallas Rustlers: LF Scott Singletary was designated for assignment, placed on waivers and taken off the secondary (40-man) roster.
Miami Hurricanes: C Gabriel Serrano was designated for assignment, placed on waivers and taken off the secondary (40-man) roster.
Detroit Dukes: SP Jake Dieckmann was added to the secondary (40-man) roster.
Atlanta Kings: SP Steve Usher was added to the secondary (40-man) roster.
Phoenix Firebirds: Signed Manager Bill Benisch to a 3-year, $43,500 per year contract.
St. Louis Stallions: Signed General Manager Pete Piecuch to a 3-year, $47,500 per year contract.
San Diego Seraphs: Claimed RP Ishmael Banks off waivers from Phoenix.
Philadelphia Fury: Claimed RP Ricky Velez off waivers from New York.
Denver Rocketeers: Claimed RP Ty Harris off waivers from Nashville.
Denver Rocketeers: Claimed C Raul Rosas off waivers from St. Louis.
Pittsburgh Express: Claimed RP Jonathan Farina off waivers from Denver.
Cincinnati Cougars: Signed free agent RP Chase Sullivan to a minor league contract.
Thursday, November 3rd , 1977
Tampa Bay Storm: RP George Meyer was designated for assignment and placed on irrevocable waivers.

Wednesday, November 2nd , 1977
Detroit Dukes: Released RP Bill Hackman.
St. Louis Stallions: Signed free agent RP Johnny Shoemaker to a minor league contract.
The Philadelphia Fury traded 30-year old minor league RHP Manny Gomez to the Tampa Bay Storm, getting 22-year old minor league 1B Bob Mendoza in return.

The Minneapolis Blizzard traded 34-year old RHP Pedro Reina (retaining 45%) to the San Diego Seraphs, getting 27-year old 3B Jorge Garcia and 23-year old minor league RHP Dwayne Lewis in return.

Wednesday, February 23rd , 1977
Detroit Dukes: Signed free agent RF Chris Martin to a minor league contract.
Minneapolis Blizzard: Signed free agent RP Manny de la Ossa to a minor league contract.
The Minneapolis Blizzard traded 21-year old minor league RHP Mario Ayala to the Miami Hurricanes, getting 30-year old C Jonathan Thompson (retaining 70%) and 22-year old minor league 3B Jose Heredia in return.
